title: Stop feeding the hype and start resisting

last_post.content: Even open access scientific work, represented by full scrapes of journals.plos.org (#5) and frontiersin.org (#14), is typically licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution license that requires careful attribution at article level (i.e., crediting the individual paper and its authors). Today's text generators automate plagiarism (as pointed out by @Iris) and fail the most basic legal requirements of consent and attribution. Using them is frankly irresponsible https://irisvanrooijcogsci.com/2023/01/14/stop-feeding-the-hype-and-start-resisting/

https://doctorow.medium.com/how-to-make-the-least-worst-mastodon-threads-daa33943ac31

17/

Wikipedia is now on Mastodon, at @wikipedia!

They've taken an interesting approach here, as it is an account run by the community, where everyone can contribute (explanation here: https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/@Wikipedia). At the same time, it is verified on the official homepage of wikipedia.org, as you can see in the screenshot.

Personally, I think this suits the spirit of the fediverse that the Wikipedia account is not a PR department, but community members building something together!

title: Why is the Colorado river drying up? Feeding cows is a large part

last_post.content:
This is a must-read Vox piece on what's causing the water crisis in the West: Cows.

There's no way around it. We're draining the Colorado river for cows. Everything else is a literal drop in the bucket. Municipal conservation cannot solve the problem. Drying up golf courses and lawns cannot solve the problem.

It's. The. Cows.

https://www.vox.com/the-highlight/23655640/colorado-river-water-alfalfa-dairy-beef-meat

#climate #climatechange #agriculture #cattle #cows #colorado #coloradoriver #drought

title: How to pitch MIT Technology Review

last_post.content:
I normally post these on Twitter, but it just occurred to me I could try doing so here: MIT Technology Review has an open call for pitches, for our upcoming issue on ⚖️ethics⚖️. We're looking for *big* swings: features, investigations, profiles, and sharp essays at the intersection of #ethics and #technology. Rates: $1-2/word.

Pitch deadline is tomorrow: April 20. Short notice, I know! If you have an idea, but need a day or two to write up a pitch, send me an e-mail (see https://www.technologyreview.com/how-to-pitch-mit-technology-review/)
Posse Is an Abbreviation for Publish (On Your) Own Site, Syndicate Elsewhere - https://indieweb.org/POSSE

If you're in or even vaguely around Philly in June, there are still spaces available in my Creative Coding class at the Penn Dream Lab. No coding experience required. In fact, no experience is preferred! I've taught this course several years now and it's always a delight to introduce computational creativity to grad students, faculty, librarians, and alt-ac folks. https://web.sas.upenn.edu/dream-lab/creative-coding-2023/

title: News outlets, Twitter, and the fediverse

last_post.content:
German news website @heiseonline has been very active on the #fediverse, now the second largest news account. Editor @mho has extensively documented the process.

Findings compared to their (6x sized) Twitter account:

Way higher engagement than Twitter
Website traffic slightly below Twitter

Valuable information for any news organisation that is debating whether to leave Twitter, and which platform to join instead!

@fediversenews @spreadmastodon

Read it all at: https://fediversereport.com/news-outlets-twitter-and-the-fediverse/

For those curious, the technical path it took was:

1. Adding the link to the wikipedia.org template: https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/wikimedia/portals/+/908683

2. Merging the automated weekly portal build that fills in the template: https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/wikimedia/portals/deploy/+/909190

3. Updating the git submodule in the main deployment repository: https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/operations/mediawiki-config/+/909303

4. Actually deploying the change: https://sal.toolforge.org/log/lfLsj4cBxE1_1c7sI5sQ

title: Don't get it twisted: Fox's $787.5M defamation deal is record-setting, massive and painful, experts say

last_post.content:
Three prominent First Amendment lawyers uniformly agreed that Fox’s $787.5 million deal was record-setting, massive, and would be too painful for the network to ignore.

It's more than half of Fox's earnings from 2022.

Why they say you shouldn't believe the naysayers. https://lawandcrime.com/2020-election/dont-get-it-twisted-foxs-787-5m-defamation-deal-is-record-setting-massive-and-painful-experts-say/

title: The Future of Social Media Is a Lot Less Social

last_post.content: Thoughtful column from NYTimes Brian Chen on possible futures for social media - draws heavily on our Three-Legged Stool whitepaper: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/04/19/technology/personaltech/tiktok-twitter-facebook-social.html

Tech companies have gotten increasingly secretive about the data, scraped from the internet without compensation or consent, used to train their AI models. So we looked closer. Here's our analysis of the 15 million websites in just one highly-filtered CommonCrawl web scrape-used to train models like Google's T5 & Facebook's LLaMA.
We found
-the copyright symbol appears >200M times
-pirated sites, 1 for e-books
-half of the top 10 were news sites https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/interactive/2023/ai-chatbot-learning

https://scikit-learn.org/dev/auto_examples/index.html

title: Yubico is merging with ACQ Bure: merged company intends to go public on Nasdaq First North Growth Market in Stockholm

last_post.content:
For years, Yubico has been a amazing company to work with. Their business model has been simple: they sell you a (kinda pricey) security key, and that's it. You don't have to interact with them anymore. They've also had great public benefit programs; they've literally given my teams hundreds of free security keys to work on elections.

Needless to say, I'm pretty WELP on the news that they're going public via a SPAC.

https://www.yubico.com/blog/yubico-is-merging-with-acq-bure/

title: GitHub - aparrish/material-of-language: Notes and notebooks for Material of Language

last_post.content: I have shared the notes and example code for "Computational Letterforms and Layout" (previously "Material of Language"), a course I teach at ITP on computer-generated concrete poetry and asemic writing https://github.com/aparrish/material-of-language the code is in python (provided as jupyter notebooks) and the notes are newly updated to use the excellent vsketch library. you can also find the reading list for the class here: https://cll.decontextualize.com/schedule/

Keynote by Laura Acion on the collective creation of #OpenScience.

Laura is highlighting communities such as R Ladies, Open Life Science, @turingway, and MetaDocencia.
We'll talk more about The Turing Way tomorrow at #CSVconf!

https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1UWmJnNWZhDxASFCGARluvWXSfF5zxMHxdqMdUI9L6Ks/

Just published this analysis on the websites that power AI chatbots. We looked specifically at C4, used by Google, Facebook and others.

Some of my favorite findings:
- RT.com (Russian propaganda) is 65th ranked site in here
- Two of the top 100 sites are voter registration databases w names, addresses, party (why?)
- More that 500,000 personal blogs, including mine
- "©" appears > 200 million times

More interesting nuggets in here: https://wapo.st/3AcdDUm

title: Seeing Like a Toolkit: How Toolkits Envision the Work of AI Ethics | Proceedings of the ACM on Human-Computer Interaction

last_post.content:
Sharing a new (open access!) #CSCW paper co-authored with Michael Madaio & Nick Merrill:

"Seeing Like a Toolkit: How Toolkits Envision the Work of AI Ethics" https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3579621

We analyze a set of AI ethics toolkits to understand how they imagine the *work* of doing ethics. (Who's doing it? When and how? How should a worker justify doing ethics work?). Broadly there's a lack of guidance about org & institutional power dynamics.

(I'll be at #CHI2023 if you want to chat more!)

https://mastodon.social/@Snoro/110228045387516982

A new Misskey/Calckey client for iOS just came out!

It’s called Kimis. Unlike other clients, the interface is accessible in English.

This is much needed because Misskey doesn’t use Mastodon’s API—it has its own. Which means most Fediverse clients aren’t usable with Misskey.

But that’s okay because Kimis is here to the rescue!

The download link is here:

https://apps.apple.com/ca/app/kimis-a-client-for-misskey/id1667275125

Also see screenshots of me running Kimis with my Calckey account on vancity.social.

@fediversenews

title: Donations are needed now for Cambridge Day - Cambridge Day

last_post.content:
The last local print newspaper in Cambridge (the Cambridge Chronicle) has eliminated all investment in local news, which has left the (online-only) Cambridge Day as the only remaining local news source. In order to take that role on appropriately, the paper's advisory board has decided to pursue a crowdfunding strategy to ensure the long term survival of this vital local news source.

Announcement: https://www.cambridgeday.com/2023/04/18/donations-are-needed-now-for-cambridge-day/

Crowdfunding link: https://gofund.me/2b1e09ad

title: Designing for Reduced Motion | Craft CMS

last_post.content:
Designing for Reduced Motion: https://craftcms.com/blog/designing-for-reduced-motion
As a user with vestibular disorder, I beg you, please, respect my prefers-reduced-motion OS settings. Your parallax and flying content animations are making me nauseous. And, no, I'm not exaggerating, and I’m not the only one.
#Accessibility

title: Twitter quietly edited its hateful conduct policy to drop transgender protections

last_post.content: To those that say only the privileged can afford to leave Twitter, I argue that it is far more privileged to ask your audience to join you on an immensely hostile and hate-filled platform. This is not ok. https://arstechnica.com/tech-policy/2023/04/twitter-quietly-edited-its-hateful-conduct-policy-to-drop-transgender-protections/
Musk systematically punishes reporters on Twitter for coverage he doesn’t like. For this reason alone, no journalist should be on Twitter. https://journa.host/@w7voa/110228528322091511
